<h3 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="moving-average-filters">Moving Average Filters<a href="#moving-average-filters" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Moving Average Filters" title="Direct link to Moving Average Filters">â€‹</a></h3>
<h4 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="ema-filter">EMA Filter<a href="#ema-filter" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to EMA Filter" title="Direct link to EMA Filter">â€‹</a></h4>
<p>Default: <code>false</code></p>
<p>PURPOSE<br>
<!-- -->Applies an EMA-based trend filter to signals, ignoring trades outside the EMA direction.</p>
<p>IMPACT<br>
<!-- -->Filters out trades that conflict with short-term trend direction.</p>
<p>RECOMMENDATIONS</p>
<ul>
<li>Enable for trend-following strategies</li>
<li>Combine with volatility filter</li>
<li>Adjust EMA period to match your timeframe</li>
</ul>
<h4 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="sma-filter">SMA Filter<a href="#sma-filter" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to SMA Filter" title="Direct link to SMA Filter">â€‹</a></h4>
<p>Default: <code>false</code></p>
<p>PURPOSE<br>
<!-- -->Applies an SMA-based filter for higher-level trend validation.</p>
<p>IMPACT<br>
<!-- -->Filters out trades that conflict with a slower, more stable trend measure.</p>
<p>RECOMMENDATIONS</p>
<ul>
<li>Use for swing trading or longer timeframes</li>
<li>Combine with fast EMA or ADX filters</li>
<li>Consider 200 SMA for major trend identification</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="market-condition-filters">Market Condition Filters<a href="#market-condition-filters" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Market Condition Filters" title="Direct link to Market Condition Filters">â€‹</a></h3>
<h4 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="volatility-filter">Volatility Filter<a href="#volatility-filter" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Volatility Filter" title="Direct link to Volatility Filter">â€‹</a></h4>
<p>Default: <code>true</code></p>
<p>PURPOSE<br>
<!-- -->Avoids trading in low-volatility conditions that can produce choppy signals.</p>
<p>IMPACT<br>
<!-- -->Helps skip periods where price moves are weak or range-bound.</p>
<p>RECOMMENDATIONS</p>
<ul>
<li>Keep enabled for most strategies</li>
<li>Especially useful in momentum trading</li>
<li>Disable in steady, range-bound markets if you prefer mean reversion</li>
</ul>
<div class="theme-admonition theme-admonition-info admonition_O170 alert alert--info"><div class="admonitionHeading_N7m1"><span class="admonitionIcon_lGrb"><svg viewBox="0 0 14 16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7 2.3c3.14 0 5.7 2.56 5.7 5.7s-2.56 5.7-5.7 5.7A5.71 5.71 0 0 1 1.3 8c0-3.14 2.56-5.7 5.7-5.7zM7 1C3.14 1 0 4.14 0 8s3.14 7 7 7 7-3.14 7-7-3.14-7-7-7zm1 3H6v5h2V4zm0 6H6v2h2v-2z"></path></svg></span>Technical Detail</div><div class="admonitionContent_c321"><p>The volatility filter helps avoid choppy market conditions where signals may be less reliable. It's especially useful in ranging markets.</p></div></div>
<h4 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="regime-filter">Regime Filter<a href="#regime-filter" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Regime Filter" title="Direct link to Regime Filter">â€‹</a></h4>
<p>Default: <code>true</code></p>
<p>PURPOSE<br>
<!-- -->Distinguishes trending vs. ranging environments using a threshold-based logic.</p>
<p>IMPACT<br>
<!-- -->Prevents applying trend-following logic in sideways conditions.</p>
<p>RECOMMENDATIONS</p>
<ul>
<li>Crucial if your strategy performs poorly in chop</li>
<li>Adjust threshold for faster or slower detection</li>
<li>Start with 0.1 and adjust based on market</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="trend-strength-filters">Trend Strength Filters<a href="#trend-strength-filters" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Trend Strength Filters" title="Direct link to Trend Strength Filters">â€‹</a></h3>
<h4 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="adx-filter">ADX Filter<a href="#adx-filter" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to ADX Filter" title="Direct link to ADX Filter">â€‹</a></h4>
<p>Default: <code>false</code></p>
<p>PURPOSE<br>
<!-- -->Checks ADX to ensure sufficient trend strength before entering trades.</p>
<p>IMPACT<br>
<!-- -->Skipping trades when ADX is below threshold can reduce false breakouts.</p>
<p>RECOMMENDATIONS</p>
<ul>
<li>Enable if you only want strong trends</li>
<li>Combine with smaller threshold if your market is often volatile</li>
<li>Consider 20-25 range for standard trend detection</li>
</ul>
<h3 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="multi-timeframe-filters">Multi-timeframe Filters<a href="#multi-timeframe-filters" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Multi-timeframe Filters" title="Direct link to Multi-timeframe Filters">â€‹</a></h3>
<h4 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="daily-kernel-filter">Daily Kernel Filter<a href="#daily-kernel-filter" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Daily Kernel Filter" title="Direct link to Daily Kernel Filter">â€‹</a></h4>
<p>Default: <code>false</code></p>
<p>PURPOSE<br>
<!-- -->Uses daily timeframe kernel logic to confirm signals on lower timeframes.</p>
<p>IMPACT<br>
<!-- -->Ensures you only trade in harmony with big-picture daily trends or expansions.</p>
<p>RECOMMENDATIONS</p>
<ul>
<li>Enable for multi-timeframe strategies</li>
<li>Useful for avoiding counter-trend trades</li>
<li>Consider computational impact on your platform</li>
</ul>
<h2 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="filter-combinations">Filter Combinations<a href="#filter-combinations" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Filter Combinations" title="Direct link to Filter Combinations">â€‹</a></h2>
<p>Understanding how different filters work together is key to optimizing your configuration:</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>EMA + Volatility</strong>: Great for trending markets</li>
<li><strong>Regime + ADX</strong>: Excellent for avoiding choppy conditions</li>
<li><strong>Daily Kernel + SMA</strong>: Strong multi-timeframe confluence</li>
<li><strong>Volatility + ADX</strong>: Powerful for breakout validation</li>
</ul>
<div class="theme-admonition theme-admonition-note admonition_O170 alert alert--secondary"><div class="admonitionHeading_N7m1"><span class="admonitionIcon_lGrb"><svg viewBox="0 0 14 16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M6.3 5.69a.942.942 0 0 1-.28-.7c0-.28.09-.52.28-.7.19-.18.42-.28.7-.28.28 0 .52.09.7.28.18.19.28.42.28.7 0 .28-.09.52-.28.7a1 1 0 0 1-.7.3c-.28 0-.52-.11-.7-.3zM8 7.99c-.02-.25-.11-.48-.31-.69-.2-.19-.42-.3-.69-.31H6c-.27.02-.48.13-.69.31-.2.2-.3.44-.31.69h1v3c.02.27.11.5.31.69.2.2.42.31.69.31h1c.27 0 .48-.11.69-.31.2-.19.3-.42.31-.69H8V7.98v.01zM7 2.3c-3.14 0-5.7 2.54-5.7 5.68 0 3.14 2.56 5.7 5.7 5.7s5.7-2.55 5.7-5.7c0-3.15-2.56-5.69-5.7-5.69v.01zM7 .98c3.86 0 7 3.14 7 7s-3.14 7-7 7-7-3.12-7-7 3.14-7 7-7z"></path></svg></span>Why These Defaults?</div><div class="admonitionContent_c321"><p>Default values are chosen to offer a good balance between signal quality and quantity. They provide meaningful filtering while avoiding over-restriction of trading opportunities.</p></div></div>
<h2 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="summary">Summary<a href="#summary" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Summary" title="Direct link to Summary">â€‹</a></h2>
<p>The filter settings provide multiple layers of signal refinement for the Lorentzian Classification model. While the defaults offer a solid starting point, understanding each filter's purpose allows you to create a custom configuration that matches your trading style and market conditions.</p>
<p>Try experimenting with the interactive demo above to see how different filter combinations affect signal generation. Each setting has detailed documentation that appears when you click on it in the interface.</p>
<h2 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="example-configurations">Example Configurations<a href="#example-configurations" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Example Configurations" title="Direct link to Example Configurations">â€‹</a></h2>
<h3 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="conservative-trend-following">Conservative Trend Following:<a href="#conservative-trend-following" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Conservative Trend Following:" title="Direct link to Conservative Trend Following:">â€‹</a></h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Volatility Filter:</strong> True - <em>Reasoning: Avoids trading in choppy, low-volatility environments, reducing the risk of false signals.</em></li>
<li><strong>Regime Filter:</strong> True (Threshold: 0.1) - <em>Reasoning: Confirms a trending market before entering trades, ensuring the model is operating in a favorable regime.</em></li>
<li><strong>ADX Filter:</strong> True (Threshold: 25) - <em>Reasoning: Ensures sufficient trend strength for reliable signals, filtering out weak or uncertain trends.</em></li>
<li><strong>EMA Filter:</strong> True (Period: 50) - <em>Reasoning: Aligns trades with short-term momentum, providing additional confirmation of the trend.</em></li>
<li><strong>SMA Filter:</strong> True (Period: 200) - <em>Reasoning: Validates trades with the long-term trend, ensuring alignment with the overall market direction.</em></li>
<li><strong>Daily Kernel Filter:</strong> False - <em>Reasoning: Focuses on the current timeframe without multi-timeframe confirmation, simplifying the analysis.</em>
<em>This configuration is designed for Fixed Income/Conservative Traders who prioritize safety and trend alignment. It employs multiple filters to ensure that only high-probability, trend-aligned signals are generated, minimizing risk and false positives. The SMA and EMA filters align with long and short term trends, ADX ensures trend strength, and the Volatility and Regime filters avoid choppy markets. This setup is ideal for long-term investors or those with a low-risk tolerance.</em></li>
</ul>
<h3 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="aggressive-scalping">Aggressive Scalping:<a href="#aggressive-scalping" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Aggressive Scalping:" title="Direct link to Aggressive Scalping:">â€‹</a></h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Volatility Filter:</strong> False - <em>Reasoning: Allows trading in all market conditions, including low-volatility periods, to maximize signal frequency.</em></li>
<li><strong>Regime Filter:</strong> True (Threshold: -0.2) - <em>Reasoning: Captures even weak trends, suitable for scalping, where small price movements can be profitable.</em></li>
<li><strong>ADX Filter:</strong> False - <em>Reasoning: Disables trend strength confirmation for faster signal generation, allowing for quicker entries and exits.</em></li>
<li><strong>EMA Filter:</strong> False - <em>Reasoning: Removes short-term trend alignment for quicker entries, prioritizing speed over confirmation.</em></li>
<li><strong>SMA Filter:</strong> False - <em>Reasoning: Disables long-term trend validation for faster exits, essential for capturing small profits.</em></li>
<li><strong>Daily Kernel Filter:</strong> False - <em>Reasoning: Focuses solely on the current timeframe for scalping, ignoring higher timeframe context.</em>
<em>This configuration is tailored for Alert Automation Users and Performance Tweakers focused on scalping strategies. It disables most filters to maximize signal frequency and responsiveness, prioritizing speed over signal quality. The Regime filter with a negative threshold is used to capture even weak trends, while the absence of other filters allows for quick entries and exits in fast-moving markets. This setup is best suited for experienced scalpers who can manage the increased risk of false signals and require a high volume of trades.</em></li>
</ul>
<h3 class="anchor anchorWithStickyNavbar_NHr2" id="multi-timeframe-confluence">Multi-Timeframe Confluence:<a href="#multi-timeframe-confluence" class="hash-link" aria-label="Direct link to Multi-Timeframe Confluence:" title="Direct link to Multi-Timeframe Confluence:">â€‹</a></h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Volatility Filter:</strong> True - <em>Reasoning: Avoids trading in choppy, low-volatility environments, improving signal reliability.</em></li>
<li><strong>Regime Filter:</strong> True (Threshold: 0.1) - <em>Reasoning: Confirms a trending market before entering trades, ensuring the model operates in a favorable regime.</em></li>
<li><strong>ADX Filter:</strong> False - <em>Reasoning: Allows for signals even if the trend strength is not high on the current timeframe, providing more opportunities for entry.</em></li>
<li><strong>EMA Filter:</strong> False - <em>Reasoning: Avoids over-filtering and maintains responsiveness on lower timeframes, allowing for quicker reactions to price movements.</em></li>
<li><strong>SMA Filter:</strong> False - <em>Reasoning: Avoids over-filtering and maintains responsiveness on lower timeframes, prioritizing short-term opportunities.</em></li>
<li><strong>Daily Kernel Filter:</strong> True - <em>Reasoning: Ensures trades align with the higher timeframe (Daily) trend, providing a broader perspective on market direction.</em>
<em>This configuration is designed for Visual Confluence Traders who seek confirmation from a higher timeframe before entering trades. It enables the Daily Kernel Filter to ensure that all signals align with the daily trend, providing a broader perspective on market direction. The Volatility and Regime filters help to avoid trading in choppy or ranging markets, while the SMA and EMA filters are disabled to maintain responsiveness on lower timeframes. This setup is ideal for traders who use Lorentzian Classification as a confluence tool to confirm their trading decisions based on higher timeframe analysis.</em></li>
</ul></div></article><nav class="docusaurus-mt-lg pagination-nav" aria-label="Docs pages"><a class="pagination-nav__link pagination-nav__link--prev"
